reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening women’s autonomy in Macaya

description.narrative: The project aims at increasing the autonomy of women in the rural communities in Macaya through strengthening their economic opportunities and participation in decision-making. This kind of empowerment requires building women’s basic capacities such as l iteracy, organisational and leadership skills as well as their awareness on human rights, particularly women’s rights and sexual and reproductive rights. Simultaneously, their economic and livelihoods skills are strengthened, in order to both increase th eir revenues and strengthen the valorisation of their work and role in the communities. 1. Women have the capacity to effectively participate in decision making • Functional literacy and consciousness-raising • Strengthening the social dynamics and fem ale leadership (community development, networking, cohesion, identifying new initiatives) • Advocacy on women’s rights • Awareness-raising in reproductive health, Human Rights, Gender and citizenship 2. Women’s entrepreneurial initiatives contribut e to their full empowerment• Development of entrepreneurial initiatives • Skills training • Support and capacity building to women's groups engaged in entrepreneurial activities • Training and awareness-raising on environmental protection and ratio nal use of natural resources• Training of project staff Rights-holders /beneficiaries: The female population in the intervention area is roughly 1 800. Most of the women in the project area have no basic education and are illiterate. Their vulnerability and poverty is linked to not having access to resources and basic services (education, health, food, justice etc.). They undertake small trade activities (selling matches, sweets, etc.), and production and sales of agricultural products (garden produce and spices). Implementing partner: Lutheran World Federation/Department of World Service (LWF/DWS) Haiti.
